item.title: Pancakes
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Not vegan, contains eggs and milk!

Ingredients

  • 250 g flour
  • 2 tablespoons baking powder
  • 500 g milk
  • 2 or 3 eggs
  • A bit of butter

Preparation

  1. Mix the flour and the baking powder
  2. Slowly add the milk and mix
  3. Add the eggs and mix
  4. Add a bit of butter to a large pan and heat
  5. Make the pancakes

item.title: Lentil Bolognese
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 clove of garlic
  • 1 onion
  • 1 carrot
  • 1 stalk of celery
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 150 g red lentils
  • 400 g strained tomatoes - or chopped tomatoes (= 1 tin)
  • 250 ml vegetable stock
  • 1 tbsp Italian herbs
  • salt
  • pepper

Procedure

  1. Wash the lentils thoroughly, then set aside.
  2. Finely chop the garlic and onion, dice the carrot and celery.
  3. Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the onions.
  4. Add the carrots and celery and fry for 5 minutes over a medium heat.
  5. Stir in the tomato purée, garlic and herbs.
  6. Add the tomato purée, vegetable stock and lentils, bring to the boil, cover and simmer over a medium heat for 15 minutes. Add water if necessary.

Source: https://www.gaumenfreundin.de/rote-linsenbolognese-einfach-und-vegan/

item.title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

For the Brownies

  • 200 g Dark Chocolate
  • 125 g Softened Butter
  • 1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
  • 3 Eggs
  • 200 g Brown Sugar
  • 150 g Flour
  • 1 tsp Baking Powder
  • 1 Pinch of Salt
  • 1 tbsp Cocoa Powder

For the Dessert

  • 1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
  • 2 tsp Cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
  • 400 g Cream
  • 250 g Low-Fat Quark
  • 4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

Preparation

Brownies

  1. Melt dark chocolate with butter in a double boiler. Let it cool briefly.
  2. Mix vanilla sugar, brown sugar, and eggs together.
  3. Add the chocolate-butter mixture and mix.
  4. Mix flour with baking powder, salt, and cocoa powder, and stir into the remaining batter.
  5. Grease a brownie pan (28.5 x 23 cm).
  6. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (convection: 160 degrees).
  7. Pour the batter into the pan and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes.
  8. Allow the brownies to cool completely.

Cherry Compote

  1. Drain the Morello cherries over a sieve, collecting 400ml of juice.
  2. Mix about 2 tbsp of the juice with cornstarch and powdered sugar until smooth.
  3. Heat the remaining juice in a pot. Add the starch-juice mixture and bring to a boil until it starts to thicken.
  4. Add the drained cherries and stir well.
  5. Let it cool slightly.

Creamy Quark Cream

  1. Whip the cream until stiff and mix with low-fat quark and powdered sugar.
  2. Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the cherry mixture onto the brownie pieces in the glass.

Assembly

  1. Take 1 tablespoon of brownies and break it into small pieces.
  2. Place brownie pieces in dessert glasses (approx. 125ml filling capacity).
  3. Pipe a layer of cream onto the cherry mixture in each glass.
  4. Repeat this process for another layer in each dessert glass.
  5. Refrigerate dessert glasses until ready to serve.

Source

https://www.einfachbacken.de/rezepte/schwarzwaelder-kirsch-dessert-einfach-selber-machen

item.title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 180 g Soft Dates, pitted
  • 200 ml Cream
  • 3 Eggs
  • 1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
  • 4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
  • 100 g Flour
  • 1.5 tsp Baking Soda
  • 80 g Butter
  • Some Butter for greasing the pan

Preparation

  1. Preheat the oven to 170 °C (convection).
  2. Puree dates with cream, vanilla bean seeds, and cocoa powder until smooth.
  3. Then add egg yolks and butter, and blend until the mixture is homogeneous and smooth.
  4. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
  5. Mix the flour and baking soda into the cocoa mixture.
  6. Gently fold in the beaten egg whites.
  7. Pour the cake batter into any buttered baking pan.
  8. Bake in the preheated oven on the middle rack for approximately 40 minutes.

Notes

The recipe yields 16 pieces and is also suitable for muffin molds. You can enhance the cake with orange zest, ground nuts, nut butter, chili, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, or cherries. I use soft dates, which are softer than regular dates. If you only have firm dates, soak them in warm water for about 4 hours. I would use a cake pan with a diameter of 18 cm. Source: https://www.chefkoch.de/rezepte/3186881474309297/Feiner-Schokokuchen-ohne-Zuckerzusatz.html

item.title: Bananabread
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

For the cake

  • 125 grams all-purpose flour (unbleached)
  • 125 grams whole wheat or spelt flour
  • 125 grams brown sugar
  • 150 grams small seeds (whatever you like/have: sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, walnut kernels, pine nuts, chia seeds, etc.)
  • 1 good pinch of sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
  • Zest and juice of 1 lemon
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons natural or unsweetened soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
  • 2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten

For the Lemon-Sesame Drizzle (optional)

  • 1 tablespoon tahini
  • 3 tablespoons golden powdered sugar or liquid honey
  • Juice of 1 lemon

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
  2. Grease a non-stick loaf pan with butter and dust it with flour (if the loaf pan is not non-stick, you can also line it with parchment paper).
  3. Combine all the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl - flours, sugar, seeds, salt, and baking powder - and mix well.
  4. In another bowl, mash the bananas with a fork (leaving them slightly chunky if desired), then add lemon juice and zest, olive oil, yogurt, and beaten eggs, mixing well.
  5. Add the wet ingredients to the bowl of dry ingredients and gently mix - just enough to combine everything.
  6. Transfer the mixture into the loaf pan and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
  7. Optional: While the cake is baking, prepare the Lemon Drizzle. Stir tahini and powdered sugar in a bowl until smooth, add lemon juice, and mix well.
  8. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan until it’s cool enough to transfer to a wire rack. While the cake is still warm, place a large plate under the rack, then poke the cake all over with a skewer, pour the drizzle over it, and let it soak in.

item.title: Pistachio Macarons
item.description:
Ingredients

Ingredient for the Filling:

  • 20g sugar
  • 10g butter
  • 40g chopped pistachio
  • 80g white chocolate
  • 60g whipped cream
  • 1 drop of vanilla

Ingredients for macarons shells

  • 50g grounded almonds
  • 50g powdered sugar
  • 30g egg white (best if 3 to 5 days old)
  • 13g sugar
  • optional: green food coloring

In addition:

  • baking paper for macarons
  • piping bag with round tip

Procedure

  1. For the filling you need to reduce the sugar into golden caramel. Take it from the stove and add the butter. After the butter is fully dissolved, add 20g of the chopped pistachios. Now put the pistachio brittle on a baking paper and let it cool down. Mix the rest of the pistachios in the blander. Heat up the white chocolate and whipped cream. Add everything (except the brittle) together and whip it up to a ganache. Keep it in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
  2. Shred the brittle with the blender and mix it under the ganache. Keep the ganache in your refrigerator over night.
  3. For the macrons shells mix the grounded almonds and the powdered sugar using the blender. Sieve the mixture until it is a light powder. Mix the egg white until it’s white and fluffy. Slowly add the rest of the sugar. Optional you can add the green food coloring now. Fold the egg white in the almond-sugar mix, until you get a gluey dough.
  4. Fill dough into piping bag. Put baking paper on a tray. Pipe 24 round spots on the paper. Reduce air pockets in the dough by beating on the pan. Leave baking pan for at least 30 minutes in the room. The shells need to be dry. Preheat the oven up to 160°C and bake the macarons shells for at least 13 minutes (depends on the oven, my oven needs 20 minutes).
  5. Let the macarons shells chill down. Now you can fill them with the ganache and enjoy.

item.title: Bananabread
item.dc:creator: Annabel
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2 to 3 medium (7” to 7-7/8” long) very ripe bananas, peeled (about 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 cups mashed)
  • 1/3 cup (76g) butter, unsalted or salted, melted
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda (not baking powder)
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 3/4 cup (150g) sugar (1/2 cup if you would like it less sweet, 1 cup if more sweet)
  • 1 large egg, beaten
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/2 cups (205g) all-purpose flour

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C): Butter an 8x4-inch loaf pan.
  2. Mash the bananas and add the butter: In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork until completely smooth. Stir the melted butter into the mashed bananas.
  3. Mix in the remaining ingredients: Mix in the baking soda and salt. Stir in the sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract. Mix in the flour.
  4. Bake the bread: Pour the batter into your prepared loaf pan.Bake for 55 to 65 minutes at 350°F (175°C), or until a toothpick or wooden skewer inserted into the center comes out clean. A few dry crumbs are okay; streaks of wet batter are not. If the outside of the loaf is browned but the center is still wet, loosely tent the loaf with foil and continue baking until the loaf is fully baked.
  5. Cool and serve: Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for a few minutes. Then remove the banana bread from the pan and let cool completely before serving. Slice and serve. (A bread knife helps to make slices that aren’t crumbly.)

Wrapped well, the banana bread will keep at room temperature for 4 days. For longer storage, refrigerate the loaf up to 5 days, or freeze it.

item.title: Fortune cookies
item.dc:creator: Marie Bogena
item.description:
Ingredients

For the Fortune Cookies

  • Egg white from 3 eggs
  • 60g powder sugar
  • 45g margarine
  • 60g flour
  • a pinch of salt

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven on 180 degree
  2. Melt the margarine
  3. Beat the egg white with the salt until it is fluffy
  4. Mix the melted margarine with the powder sugar, the fluffy egg white and the flour
  5. Using a spoon, spread a tablespoon of the dough thinly into a circle on a baking tray lined with baking paper (or a suitable alternative).
  6. Bake it for 5-7 minutes
  7. Now everything has to happen very quickly (it’s best if everyone helps): carefully remove the still soft cookies from the paper with a knife and place a prepared note message on top.
  8. Fold the cookies into semicircles and quickly fold them again with the straight side over the edge of a bowl or glass to create the typical fortune cookie shape.

Enjoy your fortune!

item.title: Very Crispy Potatoes
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 800g waxy potatoes
  • 4 big spoons olive oil
  • 2 small spoons mild paprika powder
  • 1 small spoons salt

Procedure

  1. First, peel the 800 g of potatoes and cut them into your desired shape: potato wedges, fries, cubes, wedges, or potato slices. I personally prefer the peeled and quartered wedge shape.
  2. Place the cut potato slices directly into a bowl and mix them well with 4 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 teaspoons of mild paprika powder, and 1 teaspoon of salt. TIP: For variation, you can also mix in 1-2 teaspoons of fresh, chopped rosemary with the potatoes.
  3. Then spread the potatoes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Make sure they are all spread out separately and not stacked on top of each other.
  4. They should then bake for about 30 minutes on the middle rack of the oven or until they are lightly browned and cooked through—just do the fork test or taste test. IMPORTANT NOTE: The baking time will vary depending on the cut, so keep an eye on them. I wish you much joy with my oven potato recipe and enjoy your meal.

Source

https://emmikochteinfach.de/knusprige-ofenkartoffeln/#wprm-recipe-container-604

item.title: The best Florentiners
item.description:
Ingredients

For the shortcrust dough:

  • 175 g soft butter
  • 100 g sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 300 g flour
  • 1 pinch of salt
  • 200g dark chocolate

For the topping:

  • 175 g For the topping:
  • 125 ml whipped cream
  • 70 g sugar
  • 30 g honey
  • 30 g butter
  • 200 g ground almonds / flaked almonds
  • 2 tbsp almond kernels
  • 100 g dark chocolate coating
  • 200 g dried cranberries (chopped)

Procedure

  1. Mix the dough ingredients together and knead until it is a firm dough and leave the dough to rest for 1 hour.
  2. Roll out the dough very thinly and cut out round shapes. Bake for approx. 5 minutes at 180°C fan oven.
  3. Melt the chocolate and coat the base of the cooled cookies with chocolate and leave to harden overnight (or for 2 hours in the fridge).
  4. Heat the whipping cream, sugar, honey and butter in a saucepan, stirring constantly until the mixture caramelizes
  5. dd the flaked almonds, mix well and cook for 3 minutes, stirring until the mixture begins to brown. Transfer to a bowl, stir in 2 tbsp almond kernels. Shape the mixture into mounds using 2 oiled teaspoons and place on the cookies. Leave to cool … and enjoy.

item.title: Peanutbutter Ramen
item.dc:creator: Helene Breuer
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 3 banana shallots, peeled and chopped to get 100g
  • 2 lemongrass stalks, bottom two-thirds sliced, the rest discarded
  • 10 garlic cloves (30g), peeled and roughly chopped
  • 8cm x 8cm piece fresh ginger (60g), peeled and roughly chopped
  • 2½ tbsp gochujang paste
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1¾ tsp salt, plus ½ tsp extra for the tempeh
  • 2 tsp Rapeseed oil
  • 3 tsp light brown soft sugar
  • 4 tbsp (65g) smooth peanut butter
  • 1 x 400ml tin coconut milk
  • 2 limes, zested and quartered
  • 250g ramen noodles
  • 200g tempeh, chopped into a mince with a knife
  • 250g pak choi, shredded lengthways
  • 40g fresh coriander, chopped

Procedure

1. Make curry paste:

Put all the curry paste ingredients and two tablespoons each of rapeseed oil and water in a small blender and blitz to a smooth paste.

2. Make the ramen broth:

Next, make the ramen broth. Put three tablespoons of rapeseed oil in a large saucepan on a medium heat and, once hot, add the spice paste and fry, stirring regularly, for 10 minutes. Stir in two teaspoons of the sugar and cook for a further two minutes. Transfer a tablespoon and a half of the mix to a bowl and put to one side. Stir the peanut butter into the pan, then add the coconut milk, lime zest and a litre of water. Bring up to a simmer, then cook on a low heat for 10 minutes.

3. Make the noodles & tempeh:

Meanwhile, make the noodles and tempeh. Cook the noodles according to the packet instructions, then drain in a colander, rinse under cold water and drain again. Add a little oil to the colander, toss to coat the noodles so they don’t stick, then set aside. To cook the tempeh, put two tablespoons of rapeseed oil in a nonstick frying pan on a medium heat and, when hot, add the tempeh mince and fry, stirring often, for five minutes, until crisp and browning. Add the reserved curry paste mix, the remaining teaspoon of sugar and the extra half-teaspoon of salt, fry, stirring, for another three or four minutes, then take off the heat.

4. Serve the ramen:

To serve, divide the ramen broth between four bowls, then divide the noodles between the bowls. Top with the shredded pak choy, crumbled tempeh and coriander, squeeze the juice of a quarter of a lime over each portion and serve with another lime wedge on the side of each bowl.

item.title: Indian Dal with Red Lentils
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1-2 tbsp coconut oil or olive oil for frying
  • 2 onions diced
  • 4 garlic cloves minced
  • 2 tsp ginger grated (or more to taste)
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • 1 tsp coriander
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp red paprika
  • 1 tsp garam masala or other curry powder to taste
  • 300 g red lentils
  • 780 ml vegetable stock
  • 250 ml coconut milk
  • 250 ml pureed tomatoes or chopped tomatoes (optional)
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tsp coconut blossom sugar or to taste
  • 2-3 tbsp lime or lemon juice or to taste

Procedure

  1. Heat the coconut oil in a pan or pot. Add the chopped onions and sauté for 2-3 minutes until translucent. Then add the garlic and ginger and sauté for another minute until fragrant. Finally add the spices and sauté for a few seconds to allow the flavors to develop.
  2. Place the lentils in a fine sieve and rinse under cold running water. Then add it to the onion mixture in the pan, pour in the vegetable stock, stir and bring to the boil. Cover and simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until the lentils have absorbed most of the liquid.
  3. Then add coconut milk and pureed tomatoes (if using) and simmer for another 5-10 minutes, or until the lentils are cooked. (If the sauce is too thick, add a little more broth or coconut milk until the desired consistency is reached). Season with salt, pepper, coconut blossom sugar and lime juice.
  4. Garnish the dal with a swirl of vegan yogurt, freshly chopped parsley or coriander and sesame seeds or any other topping of your choice. Serve over rice or with vegan naan or aloo paratha. But it also tastes good as a filling for savory pancakes, crepes or tortilla recipes.

Enjoy your meal!

item.title: Cheesecake with Meringue Topping
item.dc:creator: Stella F.
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 200 g flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 2 pinches of iodized salt
  • 100 g + 100 g butter
  • 75 g + 150 g + 75 g sugar
  • 4 eggs
  • 500 g quark (e.g. 20% fat content)
  • 250 g sour cream
  • 250 ml Rama Cremefine for cooking, 15% fat
  • 1 packet of vanilla pudding powder for cooking (about 37 g)
  • 1 packet of vanilla sugar

Procedure

  1. Mix 200 g flour, 2 tsp baking powder, and 1 pinch of salt. Knead with 100 g butter, 75 g sugar, and 1 egg using the dough hooks of an electric hand mixer, then by hand until smooth. Line the form with baking paper or grease it, including the edges. Press the dough into the form, creating an edge. Chill the dough in the form until further use.

  2. Preheat the oven to 180°C (fan: 160°C). Melt 100 g butter in a pot over low heat. Separate 3 eggs; the egg whites will be used later. Beat the egg yolks with the melted butter, 500 g quark, 250 g sour cream, 250 ml Rama Cremefine, 150 g sugar, pudding powder, and vanilla sugar with the beaters of the electric hand mixer until creamy.

  3. Pour the sour cream mixture onto the dough. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for about 60 minutes. If the surface browns too much, cover the cheesecake with aluminum foil.

  4. Beat the egg whites with 1 pinch of salt using the (thoroughly cleaned) beaters of the electric hand mixer until stiff, gradually adding 75 g sugar. Spread the meringue on the cheesecake and bake for another 10-15 minutes in the oven. Let the cheesecake with meringue cool and enjoy.

  5. If the cake with meringue stands for a while, small golden sugar droplets form on the meringue - a completely natural reaction and a pretty effect. The cheesecake with meringue is therefore also called Tear Cake. For best results, cut the cheesecake with meringue using a knife dipped in hot water.

item.title: Peanut Udon
item.dc:creator: Michael Krause
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 400 g Udon (fresh)
  • 2 tbsp salted peanuts
  • 2 tbsp sesame
  • 10 g fresh ginger
  • 1 garlic clove
  • 1 large tomato
  • 1 tbsp sesame oil
  • 1/2 tsp chili flakes
  • 2 spring onions
  • 1/2 bunch cilantro
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1/2 lime
  • 2 tbsp peanut butter
  • 100 ml coconut milk

Procedure

  1. Roughly chop the peanuts, toast them in a pan with sesame seeds until golden brown, then transfer them to a bowl and set aside.
  2. Peel and finely chop the ginger and garlic. Heat sesame oil in the pan and sauté the ginger, chili flakes, and garlic over medium heat.
  3. Meanwhile, wash the tomato, dice it into small pieces, and add it to the pan.
  4. Wash, trim, and finely slice the spring onions. Wash, shake dry, and chop the cilantro. Set both aside.
  5. Place the noodles in a bowl, cover with hot water, and let them sit for 1-2 minutes.
  6. Add 2 tablespoons of peanut butter to the pan and mix well. Squeeze in the lime juice. Stir in the soy sauce and coconut milk until the sauce is creamy.
  7. Stir in 3/4 of the spring onions, drain the noodles, and add them to the peanut sauce in the pan. Mix everything well and briefly continue to fry.
  8. Divide the noodles between 2 plates and serve garnished with the remaining spring onions, cilantro, and the sesame-peanut mixture.

media:content.url: https://lennartwittkuhn.com/recipes/recipes/Add the URL to the image here

item.title: Hähnchenbrustfilet
item.dc:creator: Julius Wilke
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 4 chicken fillets
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
  • Juice of one lemon
  • 1 tsp lemon zest, grated
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh herbs (parsley, basil) for garnish

Procedure

  1. Prepare the marinade: In a bowl, mix the olive oil, chopped garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, oregano, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  2. Marinate the chicken fillets: Place the chicken fillets in a large freezer bag or a shallow dish. Pour the marinade over them and rub the fillets well with it. Seal the bag or cover the dish and let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. For a more intense flavor, marinate overnight.
  3. Preheat the grill: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
  4. Grill the chicken: Remove the chicken fillets from the marinade and let the excess marinade drip off. Place the fillets on the hot grill and grill for about 6-8 minutes per side, until they are cooked through and have nice grill marks. The exact grilling time depends on the thickness of the fillets.
  5. Serve: Place the grilled chicken fillets on plates and garnish with fresh herbs. They go well with a fresh salad or grilled vegetables.

Enjoy your meal!

item.title: Potato salad
item.dc:creator: Mareike Wagner
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 kilogram Potatoes
  • 1 Onion
  • 5 Eggs
  • 1 Jar of pickles
  • 1 Can of peas and carrots
  • 1 glass Miracel Whip light
  • Salt and pepper

Procedure

  1. Boil the potatoes and eggs and then peel them. When both are cold, cut them into small squares.
  2. Take the pickles out of the jar and keep the water, because you need it later. Then cut the pickles and the onion as well in little pieces.
  3. Drain the carrots and peas. Cut the carrots in slices.
  4. Put the potatoes, pickles, carrots, the onion and the peas into a big bowl.
  5. For the sauce mix Miracel Whip with some water from the jar of pickles, salt and pepper. Add a part of this to the bowl.
  6. Mix the ingredients in the bowl carefully. If it is to dry, add more of the sauce.
  7. Add more salt and pepper according to your taste.
  8. To ensure that it tastes really good, you should prepare the salad a few hours before eating it. You can also prepare it one day before.

item.title: Muesli recipe
item.dc:creator: Miriam Rabels
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 200 g oats
  • 20 g flour
  • 1 tbsp honey
  • 2 tbsp sunflower oil
  • 50 ml water

Procedure

  1. Place all the ingredients in a bowl and mix, preferably by hand, until the dough forms a large lump. The lump should not stick, but should also not fall apart easily. If, for example, the consistency is not right when adding up the ingredients, simply add water, flour or oat flakes carefully.
  2. Finally, crumble the mixture onto a baking tray lined with baking paper. The amount given is pretty much enough for a normal-sized tray. There’s no need to worry about the lumps baking together and you can use up all the space.
  3. Preheat the oven to 160 °C and bake the muesli for about 30 minutes.
  4. The baking time can vary depending on how the oven behaves or how tightly you have covered the tray. Just make sure that you take the muesli out when it starts to get a little dark. Don’t be disappointed if it isn’t crispy when you take it out: it will only be really crispy once it has cooled.
  5. Finally, you can add chocolate, nuts, seeds or dried fruit such as raisins or cranberries to taste.

item.title: Granola
item.dc:creator: Nicola Zuehlke
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 500 g oats
  • 50 g walnuts
  • 50 g cashews
  • 50 g almonds
  • 50 g pecans
  • 25 g cacao nibs
  • 50 g chia seeds
  • 50 g dried apricots, cranberries (or whatever you like)
  • other seeds or nuts you like
  • 2-3 teaspoons honey (or a vegan alternative)
  • 2 teaspoons cinnamon

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven.
  2. Chop the nuts, if desired.
  3. Mix all the ingredients (except the dried fruits, cacao nibs and chia seeds).
  4. Spread it on a baking sheet.
  5. Put it into the oven. Bake until the granola is golden brown.
  6. Let the granola cool. Add the dried fruits and chia seeds.
  7. Use it as a topping or enjoy it for breakfast.

item.title: Poke Bowl with Tofu and Peanut Sauce
item.dc:creator: Sanna Schrage
item.description:
two servings

Ingredients

For the Poke Bowl:

  • 200 grams firm tofu
  • 150 grams sushi rice
  • 1 small cucumber
  • 50 grams wakame (seaweed salad)
  • 100 grams shelled edamame
  • 1 small broccoli head
  • 1 medium carrot
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 mango
  • 1 avocado
  • 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
  • 1 table spoon soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon sesame oil
  • 1 tablespoon vegetable oil (for frying tofu)

For the Peanut Sauce:

  • 3 tablespoons peanut butter
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup or honey
  • 1 teaspoon chili flakes
  • 1 garlic clove, finely chopped
  • 2-3 tablespoons water (to thin the sauce)

Procedure

Prepare the Rice:

  1. Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
  2. Cook the rice according to package instructions. Once cooked, let it cool slightly.
  3. In a small bowl, mix 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, and 1 teaspoon sesame oil. Pour this mixture over the cooked rice and gently mix.

Prepare the Tofu:

  1. Drain and press the tofu to remove excess water. Cut it into bite-sized cubes.
  2. Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat.
  3. Fry the tofu cubes until they are golden brown on all sides. Remove from heat and set aside.

Prepare the Vegetables and Fruits:

  1. Slice the cucumber into thin rounds.
  2. Steam the broccoli until tender-crisp.
  3. Julienne the carrot and red bell pepper.
  4. Peel and cube the mango.
  5. Cut the avocado into slices.

Prepare the Peanut Sauce:

  1. In a bowl, mix the peanut butter, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon maple syrup (or honey), 1 teaspoon chili flakes, and finely chopped garlic.
  2. Gradually add water until the sauce reaches your desired consistency.

Assemble the Poke Bowl:

  1. Divide the sushi rice between bowls.
  2. Arrange the tofu, cucumber, wakame, edamame, broccoli, carrot, bell pepper, mango, and avocado on top of the rice.
  3. Drizzle the peanut sauce over the ingredients.
  4. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Serve:

  1. Serve the poke bowl immediately. Mix everything together before eating to ensure each bite is coated with the delicious peanut sauce.
  2. Enjoy your nutritious and flavorful poke bowl!

item.title: Vegan Pizza
item.dc:creator: Michelle Reiter
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2 1/4 tsp (1 packet) active dry yeast
  • 1 1/2 cups warm water (110°F or 45°C)
  • 3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 cup canned crushed tomatoes
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 1 tsp dried basil
  • 1/2 cup sliced bell peppers
  • 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms
  • 1/4 cup sliced black olives
  • 1/4 cup red onion, thinly sliced
  • Fresh basil leaves for garnish

Procedure

1. Prepare the Dough:

In a small bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast. Let it sit for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes frothy. In a large bowl, mix the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and add the yeast mixture and olive oil. Stir until the dough comes together, then knead on a floured surface for about 8-10 minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-1.5 hours, or until it has doubled in size.

2. Prepare the Tomato Sauce:

In a saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant. Add the crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens.

3. Assemble the Pizza:

Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C). Punch down the dough and divide it into two equal portions. Roll out each portion on a floured surface to your desired thickness. Place the rolled-out dough on a pizza stone or baking sheet. Spread a layer of tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust. Sprinkle the vegan mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce. Arrange the sliced bell peppers, mushrooms, olives, and red onions on top of the cheese.

4. Bake the Pizza:

Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted. Remove from the oven and garnish with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil.
